subject: Education
title: Why Teaching for Transfer Often Fails
description: A fast breakdown of Why Teaching for Transfer Often Fails for builders.

hook.text: Schools promise 'critical thinking' but graduates struggle to think critically.

buildup.text: Transfer is not automatic; simply learning content doesn't mean you can apply it.

discovery.text: Barnett and Ceci found that transfer drops sharply as context changes increase.

twist.text: Even explicitly teaching 'how to transfer' has weak effects without varied practice.

climax.text: Varied examples in varied contexts give transfer the best chance of occurring.

punchline.text: Transfer is earned through variety, not wished into existence.

quiz.question: What did research by Barnett and Ceci reveal about transfer?
options: Transfer decreases sharply as contextual differences increase
Transfer happens automatically with enough practice
